content:
• Tuesday, June 5, 2012
  • BOBE

    More on Bob Evans (NASDAQ:BOBE): FQ4 misses on all counts as revenue comes up flat Y/Y. Net...

    More on Bob Evans (NASDAQ:BOBE): FQ4 misses on all counts as revenue comes up flat Y/Y. Net earnings rose 20% on fewer charges and stronger operating margins. Same-store sales were down 0.6% at its marquee stores and fell 3.1% at its Mimi's chain. The company also projected FY earnings mostly below analyst estimates, expecting to earn $2.66 - $2.72 per share. Street estimates are for an EPS of $2.70. Shares -6.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:42 PM
  • MFRM

    More on Mattress Firm (NASDAQ:MFRM): FQ1 beats on a per share basis but comes up short on...

    More on Mattress Firm (NASDAQ:MFRM): FQ1 beats on a per share basis but comes up short on revenue, despite a 38% jump Y/Y. Net profit soared on stronger same-store sales as consumers' increasing willingness to spend and pent-up demand from the recession boosted top line margins. The company also raised its FY12 earnings projections, now expecting to earn $1.46 - $1.50 per share. Shares -12% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:36 PM
  • OUTR

    More on Coinstar (NASDAQ:CSTR): SBUX says it plans to introduce its new Rubi coffee kiosk in...

    More on Coinstar (NASDAQ:CSTR): SBUX says it plans to introduce its new Rubi coffee kiosk in grocery, drug and mass merchant retail channels featuring Seattle's Best Coffee beverages. For Seattle's Best Coffee, the agreement adds another strategic channel of distribution for its premium coffee. The kiosks will begin rolling out this summer, with approximately 500 kiosks expected by the end of the year and thousands more machines over the next several years. Shares +3.7% AH

     
     
     
     
    | 6:32 PM | 1 Comment
  • MRVL

    Marvell (MRVL +2.3%) rallied today on an upgrade to Market Perform from JMP's Alex Gauna, who...

    Marvell (MRVL +2.3%) rallied today on an upgrade to Market Perform from JMP's Alex Gauna, who sees the flurry of new hardware releases at Computex as a positive for the company, given its leading position in the market for hard drive controller chips (ed: LSI-OLD also figures prominently). Gauna also likes Marvell's recently-announced dividend, but is worried about a lull in PC demand ahead of Windows 8's fall launch, and Apple's growing use of solid-state drives. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM
  • IRM

    Iron Mountain (NYSE:IRM) says its board has declared a quarterly cash dividend of $0.27 per...

    Iron Mountain (NYSE:IRM) says its board has declared a quarterly cash dividend of $0.27 per share, an increase of 8% over the previous dividend. Additionally, the company's board unanimously approves a plan to pursue conversion to a Real Estate Investment Trust in an effort to maximize value to shareholders. Shares +11% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM
  • OUTR

    Coinstar (NASDAQ:CSTR) +3.7% AH on reports of an agreement with Starbucks (NASDAQ:SBUX) for...

    Coinstar (NASDAQ:CSTR) +3.7% AH on reports of an agreement with Starbucks (NASDAQ:SBUX) for thousands of Seattle's Best coffee kiosks.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • MIND

    Mitcham Industries (NASDAQ:MIND): Q1 EPS of $0.81 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $34.6M (+30.6%...

    Mitcham Industries (NASDAQ:MIND): Q1 EPS of $0.81 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $34.6M (+30.6% Y/Y) misses by $4M. Shares -7.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • MFRM

    Mattress Firm Holding (NASDAQ:MFRM): Q1 EPS of $0.31 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $209.8M (+38.1%...

    Mattress Firm Holding (NASDAQ:MFRM): Q1 EPS of $0.31 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $209.8M (+38.1% Y/Y) misses by $1M. Shares -14.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • GWRE

    Guidewire Software (NYSE:GWRE): FQ3 EPS of $0.10 beats by $0.13. Revenue of $57M (+28% Y/Y)...

    Guidewire Software (NYSE:GWRE): FQ3 EPS of $0.10 beats by $0.13. Revenue of $57M (+28% Y/Y) beats by $5M. Shares +2.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • PCYC

    Pharmacyclics' (PCYC +5.2%) ibrutinib has substantial commercial potential, says Needham. After...

    Pharmacyclics' (PCYC +5.2%) ibrutinib has substantial commercial potential, says Needham. After reviewing the data, Needham sees PCYC and collaborator Johnson & Johnson (JNJ -0.1%) being in a strong position given the drug's potential as both a front-line and relapsed or refractory agent. The firm believes a single-agent Phase 3 trial in front-line elderly chronic lymphocytic leukemia cases may be possible by the end of this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • FB

    Facebook (FB -4%) heads into the close below $26, as the company's high multiples continue...

    Facebook (FB -4%) heads into the close below $26, as the company's high multiples continue giving investors pause. The decline comes even though S&P's Scott Kessler is upgrading shares to Hold on valuation grounds. While still having concerns related to monetization, capex, IP, and governance, Kessler argues Facebook's forward PEG ratio has fallen to 1.1, making it reasonably priced relative to peers (ed: but that PEG will rise if Facebook's growth decelerates further). (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 9 Comments
  • LAYN

    Layne Christensen's (LAYN +3.3%) FQ1 profit sank 71% as the drilling services provider suffered...

    Layne Christensen's (LAYN +3.3%) FQ1 profit sank 71% as the drilling services provider suffered difficulties in its water infrastructure business, but revenue beat expectations, and LAYN expects better results in upcoming quarters. The bad news is baked in, Boenning & Scattergood says, while LAYN's plans for internal changes may encourage some investors.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM
  • GNOM

    Complete Genomics' (GNOM +5.3%) restructuring and postponement of capacity expansion are...

    Complete Genomics' (GNOM +5.3%) restructuring and postponement of capacity expansion are incremental positives for Illumina (ILMN +1.1%), observes Leerink Swann. The firm says v pricing in the whole human genome sequencing market could stabilize as a result of GNOM' actions.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM
  • MDCO

    The Medicines Co. (MDCO +2%) may benefit from new antibiotics regulation, says Leerink Swann....

    The Medicines Co. (MDCO +2%) may benefit from new antibiotics regulation, says Leerink Swann. Current bills in the House and Senate extend the market exclusivity period for new antimicrobial drugs by five years, and grant six additional months of data exclusivity for antibiotics with companion diagnostics. Leerink thinks MDCO's Oritavancin may qualify for an additional five years of "antibiotic exclusivity," which it feels could double the drug's value.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:09 PM
  • CAR

    Zipcar (ZIP +1.5%) stands to see some more direct competition as car rental giant Enterprise...

    Zipcar (ZIP +1.5%) stands to see some more direct competition as car rental giant Enterprise Holdings makes a move to offer an hourly car rental service after buying up a couple of small local brands. It's not a new story for Zipcar, as shares have already fallen off 31.2% YTD largely on fears of competition from new sources.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM
  • LAD

    Lithia Motors (LAD +3.3%) gets a lift from positive comments out of Credit Suisse today, saying...

    Lithia Motors (LAD +3.3%) gets a lift from positive comments out of Credit Suisse today, saying its risk/reward profile is attractive at current levels. The firm notes LAD is well positioned given its solid top-line growth, expense discipline, and gross margin profile.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM
  • DG

    Dollar General (DG -2.7%) looks like a bargain to Barron's with shares off on overdone fretting...

    Dollar General (DG -2.7%) looks like a bargain to Barron's with shares off on overdone fretting over a secondary offering even with the company reporting solid FQ2 numbers and improving its guidance. The Street is weighing in, with Buckingham Research raising its price target to $61 and Wedbush Morgan reiterating a $56 PT.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM
  • PPO

    The spike in shares of Polypore (PPO +3.2%) is attributed to an article discussing "soaring"...

    The spike in shares of Polypore (PPO +3.2%) is attributed to an article discussing "soaring" sales of Chevy Volt in California. The plug-in appears to be gaining ground in California, typically a sore spot for GM with just a 9.3% share of the state's market vs. 17.4% nationwide. PPO is a supplier to GM's battery cell maker.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • SHFL

    Shares of Shuffle Master (SHFL -16.1%) slump on the heels of the company's FQ2 report. Though...

    Shares of Shuffle Master (SHFL -16.1%) slump on the heels of the company's FQ2 report. Though results were in-line, investors had bid up the stock in the expectation of a more powerful quarter.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM
  • POR

    Portland General Electric (POR +1.5%) gains after being initiated with a Buy earlier at Deutsche...

    Portland General Electric (POR +1.5%) gains after being initiated with a Buy earlier at Deutsche Bank. The firm notes the stock is trading at a 10% discount to other regulated peers and above-average growth opportunities.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:53 PM
  • VHC

    VirnetX (VHC -1.8%) edges lower after the USPTO discloses one of the company's patents will be...

    VirnetX (VHC -1.8%) edges lower after the USPTO discloses one of the company's patents will be re-examined, though it will remain valid and enforceable in the interim. Shares rallied last week after Gilford Securities predicted a bright future filled with licensing revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • UHS

    The pullback in Universal Health (UHS +1.5%) creates a compelling entry point, according to...

    The pullback in Universal Health (UHS +1.5%) creates a compelling entry point, according to Deutsche Bank. The firm adds that the acquisition of Ascend Health is a sound purchase, and compelling entry pointit reiterates a Buy with a $56 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:42 PM
  • SHPG

    Cowen says Shire's (SHPGY +1.5%) low valuation makes little sense and they would be buyers at...

    Cowen says Shire's (SHPGY +1.5%) low valuation makes little sense and they would be buyers at current levels. The firm also notes that, low valuation aside, the company could announce settlements at any time with competitors regarding generics of both Adderall XR and Intuniv drugs.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM
  • URI

    Shares of United Rentals (URI +3.9%) run hot after the company catches an initiation from Piper...

    Shares of United Rentals (URI +3.9%) run hot after the company catches an initiation from Piper Jaffray at Overweight with a price target of $53.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM
  • MU

    More on SanDisk: In spite of  the downbeat pricing news, shares are up 5.3% thanks to a...

    More on SanDisk: In spite of  the downbeat pricing news, shares are up 5.3% thanks to a bullish coverage launch from Pac Crest's Monika Garg, who thinks solid-state drives (SSDs) have "hit a key inflection point" in terms of price/performance. With SSD prices falling 30% Y/Y, Garg predicts industry sales will grow 35% annually over the next 4 years, and that SSDs could make up 25% of SanDisk's 2014 revenue (up from 3% in 2011). MU +2.6% in sympathy. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM | 4 Comments
  • MPC

    Marathon Petroleum (MPC +1.7%) will buy 10 retail gasoline stations from Road Ranger for an...

    Marathon Petroleum (MPC +1.7%) will buy 10 retail gasoline stations from Road Ranger for an undisclosed price, but after this nibble, there’s still the possibility of a main course: Sunoco’s (NYSE:SUN) 4,900 gas stations. Energy Transfer (ETP), expected to close its $5.3B deal for SUN within a few months, is widely expected to sell the stations and is taking calls from interested buyers.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM | 1 Comment
  • AUXL

    Auxilium (AUXL +0.9%) ticks higher after BofA Merrill Lynch ups its price target on the shares...

    Auxilium (AUXL +0.9%) ticks higher after BofA Merrill Lynch ups its price target on the shares to $28 from $24 on the back of yesterday's positive Phase 3 results of Xiaflex in fighting Peyronie's disease.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM
  • FAST

    Fastenal (NASDAQ:FAST) -7.6% after reporting that May net sales grew 13.1%, down from 22.6% last...

    Fastenal (NASDAQ:FAST) -7.6% after reporting that May net sales grew 13.1%, down from 22.6% last year. Dividend Channel calls the industrial and construction supplies retailer oversold, especially as it ranks the stock highly. Peers W.W. Grainger (GWW -6.5%) and MSC Industrial (MSM -5.%) are also taking a hit.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM | 2 Comments
  • NAV

    Baird says Navistar (NAV -0.1%) is facing headwinds from challenges reaching EPA 2010...

    Baird says Navistar (NAV -0.1%) is facing headwinds from challenges reaching EPA 2010 certification. The difficulties are impacting demand, margins and pension liabilities, and will likely be the driver for a disappointing Q2 earnings report. The firm cuts the shares to Neutral and lowers its price target to $31 from $56.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • ANIP

    BioSante (BPAX) +22% on heavy volume after effecting a reverse stock split on Friday that...

    BioSante (BPAX) +22% on heavy volume after effecting a reverse stock split on Friday that enabled the company to keep its Nasdaq listing. CEO Stephen Simes is due to tomorrow provide an update on the Phase III trials of BioSante's LibiGel testosterone gel and a review of results involving its GVAX cancer immunotherapies.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM | 1 Comment
  • QRVO

    RF Micro Devices (RFMD +9.1%) is among the day's big winners following an upgrade to Positive...

    RF Micro Devices (RFMD +9.1%) is among the day's big winners following an upgrade to Positive from Avian Securities. As of yesterday's close, RF Micro shares were down 34% YTD. In addition, the mobile power amplifier vendor had a short ratio of 4.8 as of May 15.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM
  • ACHN

    More on Achillion (ACHN -10%): Wells Fargo agrees with Piper Jaffray, calling today's weakness a...

    More on Achillion (ACHN -10%): Wells Fargo agrees with Piper Jaffray, calling today's weakness a misunderstanding that actually creates a buying opportunity. The firm notes that the SEC Form 4 filing by Clarus Ventures actually indicates the firm is adding to its ACHN position.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN +7.3%), which has been under pressure ever since a certain social networking...

    Groupon (GRPN +7.3%), which has been under pressure ever since a certain social networking company went public, is bouncing today thanks to more positive commentary from Benchmark. The firm argues Groupon's recent success in trimming its marketing spending growth can be sustained; its valuation is cheap on an EBITDA basis; and its scale and brand make fears of worsening deal terms and margins unjustified. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM | 1 Comment
  • ERII

    Energy Recovery (ERII +1.9%) is awarded a new contract for its PX Pressure Exchanger energy...

    Energy Recovery (ERII +1.9%) is awarded a new contract for its PX Pressure Exchanger energy recovery devices for a desalination plant in the United Arab Emirates. The plant will have a total estimated capacity of 68,000 cubic meters, or 18M gallons, per day.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM
  • AMRS

    Amyris (AMRS +19.1%) says its renewable jet fuel sourced from Brazilian sugarcane has...

    Amyris (AMRS +19.1%) says its renewable jet fuel sourced from Brazilian sugarcane has successfully passed all required testing and will be used during a demonstration flight on an Azul E195 aircraft. The flight will occur in Brazil June 19 during the Rio+20 UN Conference on Sustainable Development.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM | 4 Comments
  • ACHN

    Achillion (ACHN -10.3%) getting walloped, with Piper Jaffray attributing the drop to a VC...

    Achillion (ACHN -10.3%) getting walloped, with Piper Jaffray attributing the drop to a VC carrying out a cashless exercise of warrants, and Wells Fargo calling it a filing misunderstanding. Piper Jaffray reckons Achillion's plunge presents a great buying opportunity and reiterates its Overweight rating on the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM | 1 Comment
  • LEN

    Home builders add to early gains and rebound from a selloff yesterday following the decent ISM...

    Home builders add to early gains and rebound from a selloff yesterday following the decent ISM service sector print. Lennar (NYSE:LEN) +4.4%, PluteGroup (NYSE:PHM) +3.9%, D.R. Horton (NYSE:DHI) +3.4%, M/I Homs (NYSE:MHO) +4.7%, and the ITB sector ETF +2.33%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM
  • JOY

    Joy Global's (JOY +1.3%) low takeover valuation may attract potential acquirers, as a buyer...

    Joy Global's (JOY +1.3%) low takeover valuation may attract potential acquirers, as a buyer could offer a premium of 80% and still acquire it at the least expensive net income multiple on record for the industry, Bloomberg reports. JOY trades at ~8.2x 12-month trailing earnings, lower than 90% of similar construction and mining equipment makers. One possible suitor: Komatsu (OTCPK:KMTUY).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM | 1 Comment
  • DMND

    Shares of Diamond Foods (DMND +5.1%) bounce after they etched out a 52-week low yesterday....

    Shares of Diamond Foods (DMND +5.1%) bounce after they etched out a 52-week low yesterday. Though an infusion of capital from Oaktree Capital created a buzz a couple of weeks ago, at least one trader remains skeptical thinking that the move is part of a planned lowball strategy to take over the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • CBLI

    Cleveland BioLabs (CBLI -12.5%) gives back some ground this morning after yesterday's +50% surge...

    Cleveland BioLabs (CBLI -12.5%) gives back some ground this morning after yesterday's +50% surge following the announcement that its treatment for radiation sickness yielded strong survival results in a study of 179 nonhuman primates.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • PNRA

    More collateral damage from Starbucks' announcement: In addition to competitive concerns at...

    More collateral damage from Starbucks' announcement: In addition to competitive concerns at Panera Bread (PNRA -1.8%) over the SBUX plan to offer more food items, Einstein Noah Restaurant (BAGL -0.3%) and Caribou Coffee (CBOU -1.7%) trade lower on the same worries that a beefed-up Starbucks menu could grab market share.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM | 1 Comment
  • JCP

    After all the dust settles from J.C. Penney's (NYSE:JCP) presentation at an investor conference...

    After all the dust settles from J.C. Penney's (NYSE:JCP) presentation at an investor conference (previous), shares are now trading down 1.1%. CEO Ron Johnson says (webcast) the company is in the middle stage of a three-step process to transform into a metro-area based retailer that competes with the likes of Macy's and Kohl's. In the current stage, JCP will still offer sales and promotions in an overall landscape of more stable pricing.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -5.5%) trades lower even though the big news from Starbucks...

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -5.5%) trades lower even though the big news from Starbucks didn't appear to hit it square in the face. The loss is at least partially attributable to a previous runup in GMCR shares before the announcement on unfounded speculation that it could be positive news for the company - possible even a buyout.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM | 2 Comments
  • AKAM

    Akamai (AKAM -7.7%) and Limelight (LLNW -10%) are tumbling on news of Netflix's (NFLX +0.1%)...

    Akamai (AKAM -7.7%) and Limelight (LLNW -10%) are tumbling on news of Netflix's (NFLX +0.1%) content delivery network (CDN) plans, though fellow CDN owner Level 3 (LVLT -1.8%) is off more modestly. Jefferies thinks Limelight has the most to lose, given Netflix accounted for 11% of its 2011 revenue. Netflix moved away from Akamai in 2010, though its plans could still hurt Akamai by depressing broader demand (and thus pricing) for commodity CDN services.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM
  • TAST

    Shares of Carrols Restaurant (NASDAQ:TAST) move down 14.1% in action that appears to be...

    Shares of Carrols Restaurant (NASDAQ:TAST) move down 14.1% in action that appears to be influenced by pricing on a large block trade.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:32 AM
  • BLRX

    Israel-based biopharma drug developer BioLineRx (NASDAQ:BLRX) +6% premarket after saying it...

    Israel-based biopharma drug developer BioLineRx (NASDAQ:BLRX) +6% premarket after saying it received two notices of allowance from the U.S. Patent Office related to treatments for neuropathic pain.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM

  • Market preview: EU shares are higher while U.S. stock futures are mixed and reflecting a lack of...

    Market preview: EU shares are higher while U.S. stock futures are mixed and reflecting a lack of major news, with the S&P benchmark flat. "Valuations are extremely attractive and dividend yields compared to Treasuries are at (multi-year) highs," but the global economy may well "create another down step in the short term," says Oliver Pursche of Gary Goldberg Financial Services. Later: ISM Non-Manufacturing Index, Fed speak
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • ISR

    Premarket gainers: ISR +12%. WPRT +9%. Losers: TAST -14%. FTE -9%. AKAM -5%.

    Premarket gainers: ISR +12%. WPRT +9%.
    Losers: TAST -14%. FTE -9%. AKAM -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM | 6 Comments
  • GNOM

    Complete Genomics (NASDAQ:GNOM) +9.8% premarket after announcing it's laying off ~20% of its...

    Complete Genomics (NASDAQ:GNOM) +9.8% premarket after announcing it's laying off ~20% of its workforce to cut costs and has hired a financial adviser to help it explore strategic options including a possible sale of the company. GNOM says it is delaying expanding its monthly genome capacity until customer demand increases.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:56 AM
  • NFLX

    A plan by Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) to roll out its own content delivery network isn't completely...

    A plan by Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) to roll out its own content delivery network isn't completely blowing away analysts who see the move giving the company greater visibility into future costs - but little actual savings due to the scale involved. NFLX +1.2% premarket, while content delivery network firms will be on watch today with mixed debate on the impact of Netflix's initiative. Premarket: AKAM -4.3%, LLNW and LVLT inactive.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:43 AM | 1 Comment
  • DAL

    Airline stocks could get a lift as more analysts come out with takes that yesterday's selloff...

    Airline stocks could get a lift as more analysts come out with takes that yesterday's selloff was overdone. Following up JPMorgan's note highlighting that it was local competition and not macroeconomic factors behind Delta's May traffic bust, Sterne Agee is also looking for a sector rally. Premarket: DAL +1.0%, UAL +1.2%, JBLU +1.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:29 AM
  • WBA

    Walgreen (WAG) reports total sales fell off 1.6% in May and comparable store front-end sales...

    Walgreen (WAG) reports total sales fell off 1.6% in May and comparable store front-end sales declined 1%. Although prescriptions filled at comparable stores decreased 7.6% Y/Y, the company claims that the underlying trend has improved. Shares -1.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:21 AM | 1 Comment
  • WPRT

    Westport Innovations (NASDAQ:WPRT) +8.3% premarket after announcing plans to team up with...

    Westport Innovations (NASDAQ:WPRT) +8.3% premarket after announcing plans to team up with Caterpillar (NYSE:CAT) to use natural gas technology for mining trucks and locomotives. CAT will fund the development program; terms were not disclosed. When the products go to market, WPRT expects to participate in the supply of key components. The companies also will develop nat gas technology for CAT's off-road engines.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:17 AM | 3 Comments
  • QUMU

    Shares of Rimage (RIMG) move up 2.5% premarket after the company announces that its Qumu...

    Shares of Rimage (RIMG) move up 2.5% premarket after the company announces that its Qumu subsidiary has partnered with a service provider on a multi-million dollar contract for a large company.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:56 AM
  • JASO

    JA Solar Holdings (NASDAQ:JASO): Q1 EPS of -$0.20 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $254M beats by...

    JA Solar Holdings (NASDAQ:JASO): Q1 EPS of -$0.20 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $254M beats by $20M. Shares +14.6% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:38 AM
